meanings.definition: The act of applying manure to soil to improve fertility.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use manuring to make the soil richer and help plants grow better.
meanings.sent2: The manuring of fields is essential for healthy crops.
meanings.sent3: The manuring of the garden turned out to be quite a smelly task!
meanings.sent4: Her care for the garden was like the careful manuring of a delicate flower bed.
meanings.sent5: The manuring process can be messy but is crucial for successful farming.

meanings.definition: The process of fertilizing land with manure.
meanings.sent1: Manuring is a traditional method of enriching the soil with nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on manuring to ensure their fields are fertile.
meanings.sent3: The manuring of the fields made the whole area smell like a farm.
meanings.sent4: The manuring of the land was like giving it a nutritious meal.
meanings.sent5: The practice of manuring has been used for centuries to boost crop production.

meanings.definition: The practice of spreading manure on fields to enhance crop growth.
meanings.sent1: Proper manuring can significantly increase the yield of crops.
meanings.sent2: Manuring is a common agricultural technique to improve harvests.
meanings.sent3: The manuring of the fields attracted a curious flock of birds looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The careful manuring of the soil was like giving it a natural fertilizer.
meanings.sent5: The practice of manuring fields requires patience and attention to detail.
